ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.description:
The Fd software has evolved from its early use in the Virgo DAQ system of transporting frames
over the network using the Cm package to a more general I/O framework for online and offline
applications. Its main purpose is to provide data in the frame format from and to files, shared
memory and network connection. Basic data conditioning tools like channel filtering, resampling
are now included in Fd as well as frame manipulation like channels selection, frame resizing,
trend frame building and frame merging between different streams. The frames handled by the Fd
package could contain any frame structures, from time series to events.

The Fd software has evolved from its early use in the Virgo DAQ system of transporting frames
over the network using the Cm package to a more general I/O framework for online and offline
applications. Its main purpose is to provide data in the frame format from and to files, shared
memory and network connection. Basic data conditioning tools like channel filtering, resampling
are now included in Fd as well as frame manipulation like channels selection, frame resizing,
trend frame building and frame merging between different streams. The frames handled by the Fd
package could contain any frame structures, from time series to events.

name: fd
raw_meta_yaml:
schema_version: 1

context:
  name: fd
  version: 8.61.1

package:
  name: ${{ name }}
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: http://software.igwn.org/lscsoft/source/${{ name }}-${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 0717aab001355d4f55af5a1b77179da88d3e272a1b9233371920ebb109c0ed48

build:
  dynamic_linking:
    overdepending_behavior: error
    overlinking_behavior: error
  number: 1
  skip: not linux

requirements:
  build:
    - ${{ compiler('c') }}
    - ${{ stdlib('c') }}
    - make
    - meson
    - ninja
    - pkg-config
  host:
    - cfg >=10.5.5
    - cm >=10.3.7
    - frv >=4.38.7
    - libframel >=8.46.1
  run_exports:
    - ${{ pin_subpackage("fd", upper_bound="x") }}

tests:
  - requirements:
      run:
        - pkg-config
    script:
      - test -x ${PREFIX}/bin/FdGetChannelsList
      - test -x ${PREFIX}/bin/FdGetFramesInMemory
      - test -x ${PREFIX}/bin/FdIOServer
      - test -x ${PREFIX}/bin/FdMoni
      - test -x ${PREFIX}/bin/FdRangeGating
      - test -x ${PREFIX}/bin/FdSend
      - test -x ${PREFIX}/bin/FdStat
      - test -x ${PREFIX}/bin/FdWrite
      - test -r ${PREFIX}/lib/libfd.so
      - test -f ${PREFIX}/include/fd/Fd.h
      - pkg-config --print-errors --exact-version "${{ version }}" fd

about:
  summary: Frame distribution library
  description: |
    The Fd software has evolved from its early use in the Virgo DAQ system of transporting frames
    over the network using the Cm package to a more general I/O framework for online and offline
    applications. Its main purpose is to provide data in the frame format from and to files, shared
    memory and network connection. Basic data conditioning tools like channel filtering, resampling
    are now included in Fd as well as frame manipulation like channels selection, frame resizing,
    trend frame building and frame merging between different streams. The frames handled by the Fd
    package could contain any frame structures, from time series to events.
  homepage: https://git.ligo.org/virgo/virgoapp/Cfg
  license: LGPL-2.1-or-later
  license_file: LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - duncanmmacleod
    - erinelizabethseder-virgo
    - fcarbogn
